title: AST to Platelet Ratio Index (APRI)
desc: The AST to Platelet Ratio Index (APRI) determines the likelihood of hepatic fibrosis and cirrhosis in patients with Hepatitis C.

orgreference.text: Wai CT, Greenson JK, Fontana RJ, et al. A simple noninvasive index can predict both significant fibrosis and cirrhosis in patients with chronic hepatitis C. Hepatology. 2003;38(2):518-26.

other_refer.text: Sebastiani G, Halfon P, Castera L, et al. Comparison of three algorithms of non-invasive markers of fibrosis in chronic hepatitis C. Aliment Pharmacol Ther. 2012;35(1):92-104.

data.evidence: APRI = (AST in IU/L) / (AST Upper Limit of Normal in IU/L) / (Platelets in 109/L)
data.facts:
Based on 2011 meta-analysis in Hepatology by Lin et. al:

Significant fibrosis: APRI threshold of 0.7 was 77% sensitive and 72% specific.

Severe fibrosis: APRI threshold of 1.0 was 61% sensitive and 64% specific.

Cirrhosis: APRI threshold of 1.0 was 76% sensitive and 72% specific.
